017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util.stringconverter;
019
020import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.stringconverter.NumberStringConverter.MSG_InvalidNumberFormat;
024
025import java.util.Collection;
026import java.util.Date;
027import java.util.List;
028
029import org.apiguardian.api.API;
030import org.apiguardian.api.API.Status;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter;
033
034/**
035 *  <p>{@summary An implementation for the interface
036 *  {@link StringConverter}
037 *  for
038 *  {@link Date}.}</p>
039 *  <p>This converter translates an instance of {@code Date} into a String
040 *  containing an number that represents the milliseconds since the begin of
041 *  the epoch (1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC); conversely it expects such a String to
042 *  convert it to an instance of {@code Date}. This approach circumvents the
043 *  issues that exists with the numerous String formats that otherwise exists
044 *  for {@code Date}, especially when it comes to parsing based on different
045 *  locales.</p>
046 *
047 *  @see Date#Date(long)
048 *  @see Date#getTime()
049 *
050 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
051 *  @version $Id: DateLongStringConverter.java 941 2021-12-18 22:34:37Z tquadrat $
052 *  @since 0.0.1
053 *
054 *  @UMLGraph.link
055 */
056@SuppressWarnings( "UseOfObsoleteDateTimeApi" ) // Obviously unavoidable …
057@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: DateLongStringConverter.java 941 2021-12-18 22:34:37Z tquadrat $" )
058@API( status = Status.STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
059public class DateLongStringConverter implements StringConverter<Date>
060{
061        /*-----------*\
062    ====** Constants **========================================================
063        \*-----------*/
064    /**
065     *  An instance of this class.
066     */
067    public static final DateLongStringConverter INSTANCE = new DateLongStringConverter();
068
069        /*---------*\
070    ====** Methods **==========================================================
071        \*---------*/
072    /**
073     *  {@inheritDoc}
074     */
075    @Override
076    public final Date fromString( final CharSequence source ) throws IllegalArgumentException
077    {
078        Date retValue = null;
079        if( nonNull( source ) )
080        {
081            try
082            {
083                final var time = Long.parseLong( source.toString() );
084                retValue = new Date( time );
085            }
086            catch( final NumberFormatException e )
087            {
088                throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( MSG_InvalidNumberFormat, source ), e );
089            }
090        }
091
092        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
093        return retValue;
094    }   //  fromString()
095
096    /**
097     *  Provides the subject class for this converter.
098     *
099     * @return The subject class.
100     */
101    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
102    public final Collection<Class<?>> getSubjectClass() { return List.of( Date.class); }
103
104    /**
105     *  {@inheritDoc}
106     */
107    @Override
108    public final String toString( final Date source )
109    {
110        final var retValue = isNull( source ) ? null : Long.toString( source.getTime() );
111
112        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
113        return retValue;
114    }   //  toString()
115}
116//  class DateLongStringConverter
117
118/*
119 *  End of File
120 */
